channel.title: Error_loader_client - Unable to download client (silab client help)
channel.description:
[b]Error_loader_client - Unable to download client. silabclient was unable to download the client file
# Login to your computer as an 'administator' user, and then try loading silabclient again. This should give it sufficient access to create save client cache file.
# Or, create a new directory called C:\WINDOWS\.silabclient_store_32 or /.silabclient_store_32. If possible, set that directory to have full read+write permissions so that all users can write to it. silabclient should then detect that directory and use it for its files.
if the signature does not come up for you, some security software or parental settings may be perventing you from accepting it.[/b]
This is the error i get when i try and use the webclient. So i thought, i might as well try the downloadable one that will work. It didn't....
[b]C:\Users\Jaren\Desktop>java -Xmx512m -jar SilabClient.jar 0 0 highmem members 0
java.io.FileNotFoundException: c:\windows\.silabclient_store_32\main_file_cache. dat (Access is denied) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) 0 20 40 60 80 100 silabsoft.org java.io.FileNotFoundException: c:\windows\.silabclient_store_32\cache.zip (Acces s is denied) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at tc.a(tc.java) at tc.<init>(tc.java) at client.a(client.java) at client.b(client.java) at a.run(a.java) at client.run(client.java) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: c:\windows\.silabclient_store_32\cache.zip (The s ystem cannot find the file specified) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at tc.a(tc.java) at tc.a(tc.java) at tc.<init>(tc.java) at client.a(client.java) at client.b(client.java) at a.run(a.java) at client.run(client.java) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Some strange error occured, please tell silabsoft about it. [/b]
Thats what i got when i used the downloadable version of silab. It just stopped in the middle of loading and said "connection error" forever. :angry: Anyways the source i'm using needs to use silab and i'm being forced to use moparscape.. Any help tips anything? So, I'm begging anyone to help me. Any way possible. By maybe steping me throught making a new directory, I don't even know how. :P I'm kind of a noob. plz help!

@r34p4g3pk wrote:

FileNotFoundException: c:\windows\.silabclient_store_32\main_file_cache.

Did you even read the error?

item.title: Error_loader_client - Unable to download client (silab client help)
item.dc:creator: @nubra nubra
item.description:
@nubra wrote:

[b]Error_loader_client - Unable to download client.
silabclient was unable to download the client file

Login to your computer as an ‘administator’ user, and then try loading silabclient again. This should give it sufficient access to create save client cache file.

Or, create a new directory called C:\WINDOWS.silabclient_store_32 or /.silabclient_store_32. If possible, set that directory to have full read+write permissions so that all users can write to it. silabclient should then detect that directory and use it for its files.

if the signature does not come up for you, some security software or parental settings may be perventing you from accepting it.[/b]

This is the error i get when i try and use the webclient. So i thought, i might as well try the downloadable one that will work. It didn’t…

[b]C:\Users\Jaren\Desktop>java -Xmx512m -jar SilabClient.jar 0 0 highmem members 0

java.io.FileNotFoundException: c:\windows.silabclient_store_32\main_file_cache.
dat (Access is denied)
at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method)
at java.io.RandomAccessFile.(Unknown Source)
at java.io.RandomAccessFile.(Unknown Source)
at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
0
20
40
60
80
100
silabsoft.org
java.io.FileNotFoundException: c:\windows.silabclient_store_32\cache.zip (Acces
s is denied)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.(Unknown Source)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.(Unknown Source)
at tc.a(tc.java)
at tc.(tc.java)
at client.a(client.java)
at client.b(client.java)
at a.run(a.java)
at client.run(client.java)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
java.io.FileNotFoundException: c:\windows.silabclient_store_32\cache.zip (The s
ystem cannot find the file specified)
at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(Unknown Source)
at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(Unknown Source)
at tc.a(tc.java)
at tc.a(tc.java)
at tc.(tc.java)
at client.a(client.java)
at client.b(client.java)
at a.run(a.java)
at client.run(client.java)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Some strange error occured, please tell silabsoft about it.
[/b]

Thats what i got when i used the downloadable version of silab. It just stopped in the middle of loading and said “connection error” forever. Anyways the source i’m using needs to use silab and i’m being forced to use moparscape… Any help tips anything?
So, I’m begging anyone to help me. Any way possible. By maybe steping me throught making a new directory, I don’t even know how. I’m kind of a noob. plz help!
